definition: karoshi (loanword from Japanese), death from overwork
(experienced action marker)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned

sentences.english: Even also presented "overworks dies" the phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 甚至還出現了“過勞死”的現象。

sentences.english: For deaths not designated karoshi the family gets next to nothing.
sentences.chinese: 而不被認爲是過勞死的死者家屬幾乎什麼也得不到。

sentences.english: Marat was stabbed to death, and I'm worked to death.
sentences.chinese: 馬拉是被人刺死，而我是過勞死的。

sentences.english: His eye had been worked to death when he was still young.
sentences.chinese: 眼睛過勞死好發於壯年男性。

sentences.english: That cooling layer must have been working overtime.
sentences.chinese: 那時套服裏的冷卻層肯定早就“過勞死”了。

definition: red in the face/extremely angry
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
to die/euphemism, lit. to return West or to the Western Paradise
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to stake all on one throw
better than nothing (idiom)
to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
the person who shares your bed/partner/spouse
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to force someone to do something
reckless/extremely daring
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to feel apprehensive/to be alarmed
rank/level
